data.text: @BryBrightside @Packratmom @GovNedLamont Well...Its not a talking point, it's true. If I'm wrong please show me how.
@czar_light @Leilei92258880 @GovNedLamont Fair point. As of now I think full vax is still considered only 2 dose. % vaccinated in hospital might look different if the qualification was 3 doses

@DNAchicky @Leilei92258880 @GovNedLamont My immune compromised kid has been on virtual house arrest for 2 years now, with no end in sight, no light at the end of the tunnel, and people like you are the chief apologists for that. Worse than MAGAs.
@czar_light @DNAchicky @Leilei92258880 @GovNedLamont Yes we need to keep moving the goalposts so that our partisan talking points will continue to hold up.

@DNAchicky @Leilei92258880 @GovNedLamont Blah blah blah Simpson’s Paradox blah blah but if the vaccines are effective, then overall cases would be trending down, and we would not be seeing successive, exponentially growing waves. 

Science means all the science, not branding yourself “Science Girl” and cherry picking.
@CTgarret @Packratmom @GovNedLamont Keep telling yourself that. These talking points have definitely kept each wave from being exponentially higher than the last.

@GovNedLamont You also have to look at the population variables with vacc/unvaccin hospitals, data from ct dph has 75 and 85+ population the main cause in https://t.co/zfSEOGCT34 the 128 patients of 75+ makes the 3.1x testing + and 17.5x risk of death stat an illusion
@GovNedLamont 2%. Wow. How much of that is due to false positives?
